original: Axelson, Karl Axel Arne, praktiserande läkare, Alingsås, f. 30/3/05 i Sthlm. av grosshandl. Julius A. o. Agda Lundberg. G. 30 m. Lizi Hellborg. Barn: Ulf f. 32, Eva 38, Britt 41. — Stud: ex. 23», med. kand. 26 o. med. lic. 30, allt i Sthlm. Stip. v, univ:-sanat. i Rom sex mån. 33-34, stud:res. t. Ital., Grekl., Ungern S Tyskl. E. o. aman. v. Seraf :las. o. Sabbatsb. sjukh. öronavd. 28, assist :läk. v. Hörby las. 29, e. läk. v. Sophiahemmet 30, assist :läk. v. Sahlgr. isjukh. kir. avd. sex mån. 30-32, tf. e. läk. v. Hälsingborgs las. kir. avd. samt tf. und :läk. v. Malmö allm. sjukh. 31, andre und:-läk. v. Mariestads las. 32-33, förste dito v. Alingsås las. 34-37, prakt. läk. i Ahngsås sed. 37.
translated: Axelson, Karl Axel Arne, practicing physician, from Alingsås, born March 30, 1905 in Stockholm to merchant Julius A. and Agda Lundberg. Married to Lizi Hellborg in 1930, with children Ulf (born 1932), Eva (born 1938), and Britt (born 1941). He obtained his degree in 1923, his medical degree in 1926, and his medical license in 1930, all in Stockholm. He received a scholarship for university-sanated studies in Rome for six months in 1933-1934, and also studied in Italy, Greece, Hungary, and Germany. He was a trainee and assistant at Seraf:las and Sabbatsb. ear hospital in 1928, assistant physician at Hörby hospital in 1929, a resident physician at Sophiahemmet in 1930, and an assistant physician at Sahlgr. surgical hospital for six months in 1930-1932, including serving as a temporary physician at Helsingborgs hospital surgical department and a temporary assistant physician at Malmö general hospital in 1931. He worked as a second-level assistant physician at Mariestad hospital from 1932-1933, and as first-level assistant physician at Alingsås hospital from 1934-1937. He has been a practicing physician in Alingsås since 1937.
